Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Senior Data Scientist

We are seeking an exceptional Senior Data Scientist to join our highly skilled team in Copenhagen. You will play a pivotal role in developing a state-of-the-art system that leverages Bayesian statistics and advanced theoretical concepts to estimate and understand the size of marketing and advertising audiences. This initiative is a cornerstone of Choreograph’s broader mission to revolutionise analytics capabilities across the organisation using AI and data science.

You will thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where objectives evolve rapidly and complex, abstract problems are the norm. If you are passionate about tackling challenging statistical and mathematical problems, and enjoy working collaboratively with other experts, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement Bayesian statistical models and other advanced analytical methods to estimate audience sizes and characteristics.
Collaborate closely with a multidisciplinary team to design, build, and refine data-driven solutions.
Write high-quality, production-ready Python code including package development, unit testing, and documentation.
Work independently to solve complex mathematical and conceptual problems with minimal supervision.
Engage in productive, abstract discussions with team members to untangle nuanced issues and arrive at robust solutions.
Contribute to code repositories using Git and participate in code reviews and version control best practices.
Utilize cloud computing resources for scalable data processing and model deployment.
Handle diverse data formats and ensure data integrity throughout the analytics pipeline.
Adapt quickly to changing project requirements and priorities.


Must-Have Qualifications & Skills


Postgraduate-level knowledge in probability and statistics, with a strong foundation in Bayesian methods.
Advanced Python programming skills, including experience with building packages, unit testing, and handling multiple data formats.
Demonstrated ability to solve complex mathematical and statistical problems.
Resilience and confidence in facing difficult, open-ended challenges.
Adaptability to dynamic, fast-changing environments, ideally with experience in startup-like or high-pressure settings.
Ability to work independently and creatively, finding solutions to novel problems with minimal supervision.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in discussing and resolving abstract or conceptual issues.
Familiarity with Git and repository management.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).


Nice-to-Have Skills & Experience


Programming experience in Scala and understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
Knowledge of set theory and propositional logic.
Background in media, advertising, or digital advertising analytics.
Familiarity with the unique challenges of audience measurement and marketing analytics.


What We Offer


The opportunity to work on cutting-edge analytics projects with global impact.
A collaborative, intellectually stimulating environment with leading experts.
Flexible, fast-moving work culture similar to a startup, within the stability of a global organization.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Access to world-class resources and professional development opportunities.


We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Junior Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline - Greater Copenhagen Area & Hillerød
Description:
Calling all Scientists and Engineers! It is not unusual to take the first (or next) step in career path within Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, but in this role, you can also enhance professional and personal skills, by taking them to the next level as our next Process Engineer or Scientist to join one of our many production and development sites in Greater Copenhagen Area and Hillerød, Denmark!

Your new role

We are looking for Junior Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analyzing data for recommendations for improvements and development. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

As a Process Engineer or Scientist, in day-to-day tasks, you will get a chance to:



Analyze large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
Examine and understand data from quality control (QC) analyses.
Develop, maintain, and recommend statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
Use a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
Utilize a team-based approach for recommending process improvements-optimizations.
Build on your skills and experience together with highly dedicated colleagues.
Work in a proactive, solution-oriented environment where everyone likes to share knowledge and collaborate effectively.
Handle deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
Write and execute change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
Take part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.




Being a Process Engineer or Scientist at Novo Nordisk gives you a great opportunity to play a part in shaping the future of manufacturing across the organization, in close collaboration with teach-transfer across our organization.

We will match your profile with relevant roles depending on your level of experience and professional background. We work with positions that range from entry-level to process engineers and scientists who have up to a couple years of experience. If you have a 3+ years of highly regulated production experience, please do submit your application to our Experienced Pipeline instead: Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline.

Your new department

In CMC & Product Supply, we cover the full value chain from drug and device development to marketed Novo Nordisk products. We are more than 30,000 colleagues across the globe with the shared responsibility of scaling molecules, processes, devices, and products, dedicated to supplying life-saving medicines to the patients who need them most.

Your Skills And Qualifications

We are looking for Junior Process Engineers or Scientists candidates that have the following qualifications:



A bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural sciences, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
Be interested in pharmaceuticals, with GMP knowledge being an advantage.
You can independently understand scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment, alongside having an ability to monitor data and extract information.
Be curious to connect the understanding of process science to product quality.
Have an appetite for solving complex problems, applying a systems approach to manage complexity and reaching feasible applicable solutions.
Be professionally proficient in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Danish or other language is considered a plus.




For all our Junior Process Engineers & Scientists positions, it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences and thereby, explain the purpose to get everyone onboard.



What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.



About The Greater Copenhagen Area

We have many different sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area: in Bagsværd, Gentofte, Kirke Værløse, Køge, Lyngby, Søborg and Måløv, so remember to clearly state which locations you are interested in applying to.

About Site Hillerød

Site Hillerød is an innovative and fast-growing production site. With over 4,000 talented employees, we work together to drive change for people living with serious chronic diseases. The site is in beautiful natural surroundings, and we offer a diverse array of career paths at all educational levels. Join our vibrant community at Site Hillerød and ramp up your career while we ramp up our production! Get to know us better - visit our Site Hillerød career page.

Novo Nordisk Hillerød

What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.

Apply and be matched with multiple job opportunities

When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Junior Process Engineer & Scientist positions across CMC & Product Supply in the locations where you have shown interest. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We continuously match your profile with all suitable positions to ensure that you don't miss out on any life-changing career opportunities. This means that you will automatically be considered for all openings in the area across our factories. Don't wait any longer to take the next step in your career - apply now and let us help you find the perfect match!

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months, ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Looking for something different? We have multiple talent pipelines to offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by exploring our pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying



Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify a possible match between you and our open positions.
Unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.




More information

If you have questions about these roles, you are welcome to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com.

Deadline

30 September 2025. (Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.)

Novo Nordisk is not your typical healthcare company. In a modern world of quick fixes, we focus on solutions to defeat serious chronic diseases and promote long-term health. Our unordinary mindset is at the heart of everything we do. We seek out new ideas and put people first as we push the boundaries of science, make healthcare more accessible, and treat, prevent, and even cure diseases that affect millions of lives. Because it takes an unordinary approach to drive real, lasting change in health.
Show more
HTML:
Calling all Scientists and Engineers! It is not unusual to take the first (or next) step in career path within Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, but in this role, you can also enhance professional and personal skills, by taking them to the next level as our next Process Engineer or Scientist to join one of our many production and development sites in Greater Copenhagen Area and Hillerød, Denmark!

Your new role

We are looking for Junior Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analyzing data for recommendations for improvements and development. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

As a Process Engineer or Scientist, in day-to-day tasks, you will get a chance to:


  • Analyze large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
  • Examine and understand data from quality control (QC) analyses.
  • Develop, maintain, and recommend statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
  • Use a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
  • Utilize a team-based approach for recommending process improvements-optimizations.
  • Build on your skills and experience together with highly dedicated colleagues.
  • Work in a proactive, solution-oriented environment where everyone likes to share knowledge and collaborate effectively.
  • Handle deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
  • Write and execute change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
  • Take part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.



Being a Process Engineer or Scientist at Novo Nordisk gives you a great opportunity to play a part in shaping the future of manufacturing across the organization, in close collaboration with teach-transfer across our organization.

We will match your profile with relevant roles depending on your level of experience and professional background. We work with positions that range from entry-level to process engineers and scientists who have up to a couple years of experience. If you have a 3+ years of highly regulated production experience, please do submit your application to our Experienced Pipeline instead: Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline.

Your new department

In CMC & Product Supply, we cover the full value chain from drug and device development to marketed Novo Nordisk products. We are more than 30,000 colleagues across the globe with the shared responsibility of scaling molecules, processes, devices, and products, dedicated to supplying life-saving medicines to the patients who need them most.

Your Skills And Qualifications

We are looking for Junior Process Engineers or Scientists candidates that have the following qualifications:


  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural sciences, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.

  • Have an appetite for solving complex problems, applying a systems approach to manage complexity and reaching feasible applicable solutions.
  • Be professionally proficient in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Danish or other language is considered a plus.



For all our Junior Process Engineers & Scientists positions, it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences and thereby, explain the purpose to get everyone onboard.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




Metaceutic is seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist with expertise in machine learning, AI, and big data analysis within metagenomics and microbiome-based data science. This role will be critical in strengthening our core technology engine, applying cutting-edge AI-driven data mining techniques to microbiome datasets, and contributing to the development of personalised healthcare solutions.




Key Responsibilities




Develop and optimise AI and machine learning algorithms for microbiome data interpretation.
Implement big data analytics pipelines to process large-scale metagenomics datasets efficiently.
Design and refine predictive models for microbiome-health associations.
Work closely with bioinformaticians, systems biologists, and software engineers to integrate AI-driven insights into Metaceutic’s data analysis platform.
Apply deep learning, statistical modeling, and pattern recognition to identify novel microbiome-based biomarkers and interventions.
Contribute to scientific publications, patents, and conferences in microbiome research.
Collaborate with the business team to translate scientific insights into commercial applications for healthcare and biotech partners.

‍

‍

Needed Qualifications




PhD or MSc in Data Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong coding experience in Python, R, or similar with experience in machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Experience working with metagenomic sequencing data (16S, shotgun metagenomics) and bioinformatics tools.
Proven experience in big data analysis and cloud computing (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Expertise in statistical modeling, deep learning, and AI for biological data.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in an interdisciplinary environment.
Prior experience in healthcare, microbiome science, or systems biology is a plus.

‍

‍

What We Offer




Opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI-driven microbiome research.
Competitive salary and equity options.
Collaborative and fast-paced startup environment with a strong scientific foundation.
Direct impact on shaping the future of personalised healthcare and microbiome technology.




Show more

  • Direct impact on shaping the future of personalised healthcare and microbiome technology.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com
Show more

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Place: Hillerød Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Machine Learning Scientist




FOSS Analytical A/S is looking for a talented and highly skilled machine learning scientist with a strong background in deep learning to develop our future imaging and spectroscopic solutions for food analysis.




This is an exciting opportunity, as you will have significant influence on FOSS’ future innovation opportunities. In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food and less food waste. Our solutions provide accurate measurements and analytics insights to optimize food production from raw materials to finished products, and ultimately better global usage of limited resources.










Primary tasks




Your main responsibility will be to develop and evaluate new machine learning algorithms for our analytical instruments based on imaging and spectroscopy. You will work in a dedicated project team and be responsible for the data chain. You will work in close collaboration with our hardware and software teams as well as marketing organization in taking the data chain from concept to deployment and sales release. In this task, you will be responsible for:




Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets.
Develop algorithms and data pipelines.
Design experiments to test the data chain.
Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets.
Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms.




Your daily work will be at the FOSS innovation center in Hillerød, Denmark.







About you




You hold an M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:

Extensive hands-on experience using deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Proficient in data science methodologies, including experimental design, statistical analysis, and hypothesis testing, using tools such as Python, Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
Experience in machine learning development best-practices and MLOps workflows.
Good understanding of image processing, with practical use of libraries such as OpenCV.
Familiar with optimizing deep learning models for efficient deployment on edge devices and resource constrained environments is a plus.
Previous industry experience in applied machine learning projects is considered an advantage.




We expect you to have an interest in

the full data chain of analytical instruments.
developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers.
Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain.










As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. You’re curious about new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting, incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open-minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.







We offer




We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSS´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D. Foss is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for complex development and career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSS’ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strives at delivering cutting-edge creative algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal and humorous tone.




Application




Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, but due to summer vacation in Denmark, the hiring process will start in week 31! Any questions can be directed to head of machine learning Erik Schou Dreier esd@foss.dk (please note there may be a slight delay in response due to vacation).




All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief.




FOSS

FOSS contributes to the sustainable use of our planet’s agricultural resources and thus to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We make it our business to build analytical solutions, which add value by improving food quality and optimizing production, from raw material to finished products.

FOSS helps optimize the use of food and agricultural resources by enabling customers to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste, better quality, bigger yields, and more optimal use of raw materials.

Always at the forefront of analytical technology development, FOSS provides a range of analytical solutions from laboratory to at-line and in-line solutions, across industries from dairy to grain and meat.

FOSS provides instruments and solutions to the world’s 100 largest food companies and for more than 60 years, FOSS has been innovating analytical technology.

FOSS was founded by Nils Foss in Hillerød in 1956. We are a family-owned, global company and our products and services are sold all around the world. FOSS employs more than 1,500 highly qualified people worldwide.

Show more

  • Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets.
  • Develop algorithms and data pipelines.
  • Design experiments to test the data chain.
  • Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets.
  • Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms.


Your daily work will be at the FOSS innovation center in Hillerød, Denmark.



About you


You hold an M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:

  • Extensive hands-on experience using deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
  • Proficient in data science methodologies, including experimental design, statistical analysis, and hypothesis testing, using tools such as Python, Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
  • Experience in machine learning development best-practices and MLOps workflows.
  • Good understanding of image processing, with practical use of libraries such as OpenCV.
  • Familiar with optimizing deep learning models for efficient deployment on edge devices and resource constrained environments is a plus.
  • Previous industry experience in applied machine learning projects is considered an advantage.


We expect you to have an interest in

  • the full data chain of analytical instruments.
  • developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers.
  • Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain.




As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. You’re curious about new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting, incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open-minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.



We offer


We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSS´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D. Foss is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for complex development and career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSS’ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strives at delivering cutting-edge creative algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal and humorous tone.


Application


Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, but due to summer vacation in Denmark, the hiring process will start in week 31! Any questions can be directed to head of machine learning Erik Schou Dreier esd@foss.dk (please note there may be a slight delay in response due to vacation).


All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief.


FOSS

FOSS contributes to the sustainable use of our planet’s agricultural resources and thus to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We make it our business to build analytical solutions, which add value by improving food quality and optimizing production, from raw material to finished products.

FOSS helps optimize the use of food and agricultural resources by enabling customers to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste, better quality, bigger yields, and more optimal use of raw materials.

Always at the forefront of analytical technology development, FOSS provides a range of analytical solutions from laboratory to at-line and in-line solutions, across industries from dairy to grain and meat.

FOSS provides instruments and solutions to the world’s 100 largest food companies and for more than 60 years, FOSS has been innovating analytical technology.

FOSS was founded by Nils Foss in Hillerød in 1956. We are a family-owned, global company and our products and services are sold all around the world. FOSS employs more than 1,500 highly qualified people worldwide.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Backend Engineer - Python - Copenhagen




We’re delighted to be working with one of Europe’s most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.




They’re looking to onboard an experienced backend engineer, to join one of their internal teams.




The Role




In this role, you'll be working as part of the Business Ops team - which focuses on internal processes, developer tools & creating the best possible work environment for both technical & non-technical team members.




You'll work closely with a team of engineers as well as non-technical stakeholders, before crafting innovative solutions to every day problems.




You'll be using Python, with Django being used as their main framework. Whilst this specific role is purely backend focused, they do have space for a Full Stack Engineer in the near future - so don't hesitate to reach out if you have solid TypeScript experience too.




What You’ll Bring




5+ years of commercial software engineering experience
3+ years of experience working with Python
Demonstratable experience of working with internal teams with non-technical staff
Any experience in TypeScript is a plus, but certainly not required




The Company




With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket ship’s still near the launchpad.




Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every week—helping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.




The company’s mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.




Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office I’ve ever visited, so I’m sure you’ll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.




Sound good? Apply here or contact me directly on jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

Title: Data Scientist med AI/ML-fokus til EWIIs Digitale Kundeplatforme
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hvem er vi?

Vi er en energikoncern der leverer vand og fjernvarme i trekantområdet samt el, bredbånd og ladeløsninger til kunder i hele Danmark. Vi har inden for de seneste år udskiftet alle vores digitale kundevendte platforme, og har nu en stærk digital tilstedeværelse med vores hjemmeside, flere selvbetjeningsløsninger, mobilapps og en marketing automation platform. Platformene er integrerede med hinanden og bygget på en moderne og prisbelønnet integrationsplatform, hvor data er gjort tilgængelige via microservices.

I Digitale Kundeplatforme drifter og videreudvikler vi platformene i tæt samarbejde med andre forretningsområder og vores eget tilknyttede IT-udviklingsteam. Vi er allerede i gang med at implementere databaserede løsninger, som en del af vores digitale kundeoplevelser, og ønsker nu at tage næste skridt og sætte fart på udviklingen.

Om rollen

Du bliver teamets specialist i machine learning og AI og får ansvar for at udvikle, teste og implementere modeller, der udgør det datamæssige fundament for nye digitale løsninger og services til vores kunder.

Du kommer til at arbejde hands-on med modellering, databehandling og kode – i tæt samspil med relevante afdelinger såsom IT-infrastruktur, Data Warehouse og Data Governance. Derudover vil du arbejde sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet, der arbejder med app, web, selvbetjening og marketing automation, om at integrere modellerne direkte i vores digitale platforme og løsninger, så de skaber reel værdi for vores kunder.

Hos EWII arbejder andre data scientists med forskellige formål på tværs af organisationen, og vi har allerede et stærkt teknologi- og datasetup på plads. I denne rolle får du ansvar for at udvikle modeller baseret på kundernes forbrugs- og adfærdsdata – kombineret med relevante tredjepartsdata såsom vejr- og boligdata.

Eksempler på arbejdsopgaver



Udvikling og optimering af prædiktive og præskriptive modeller, som danner udgangspunkt for vores automatiserede kommunikation
Udvikling og optimering af forbrugsalarmer baseret på machine learning og anomalidetektion, som automatisk kan opdage, hvis den enkelte kundes forbrug afviger fra deres normalforbrug
Udvikling af personaliserede forbrugsrapporter baseret på dataanalyse og integreret med generativt AI, som genererer individuelle rapporter med grafer og forklarende tekst.
Udforske nye teknologier og eksperimentere med ML- og AI-baserede løsninger på tværs af platformene.



Det tilbyder vi 

Som medarbejder i EWII er det ikke kun dit arbejde, der er i centrum - du får også mange personalegoder, der er værd at arbejde for. Hvilke goder, du kan nyde godt af, kan du blive klogere på her. 

Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du har en uddannelse inden for datalogi, machine learning, statistik eller lignende – fx cand.scient., cand.polyt. eller cand.it med specialisering i data science. Du har allerede nogen erfaring, og har et ønske om at arbejde tættere sammen med forretningen om dine modeller.

Vi lægger vægt på, at du:



Har praktisk erfaring med dataanalyse, statistisk modellering og machine learning i cloud-baserede miljøer, herunder udvikling af prædiktive og preskriptive modeller på Azure Databricks-platformen.
Har stærke kompetencer inden for Python og SQL.
Forstår, hvordan modeller omsættes til værdi i en digital forretningskontekst og gerne i forbindelse med digitale kundevendte platforme.
Trives i krydsfeltet mellem teknik og forretning og kan forklare komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer
Er nysgerrig, forretningsorienteret og trives med et stort selvstændigt ansvar for dit ansvarsområde, men sætter pris på at arbejde teamorienteret mod vores fælles vision og mål.



I rollen får du



En central rolle i et ambitiøst digitalt team med stærkt mandat og stor indflydelse.
Frihed til at eksperimentere og udvikle dine egne idéer til ML- og AI-baserede kundeløsninger
Samarbejde med kollegaer, der arbejder med digital performance, UX, app- og webudvikling, marketing automation og dataplatforme
Adgang til en moderne teknologistak samtidig med, at du bliver en del af en virksomhed med strategisk fokus på digital innovation.



Sæt et grønt fodspor sammen med os 

I EWII er hverdagen vidt forskellig for vores 700 medarbejdere. Men fælles for alle er, at fagligheden når helt ud i fingerspidserne – og den skal male fremtiden grøn. 

I EWIIs kommercielle afdelinger kridter vi kondiskoene hver dag – uanset om vi lægger arm med energimarkedet, digitaliserer forretningen eller flytter danskerne over på fiber. Sammen gør vi det, der er sort til grøn business – til gavn for miljø, kunder og bundlinje. 

Er du vores nye kollega?

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig. Du sender sit CV og motiverede ansøgning ved at klikke på ansøgningsknappen. Hos os er diversitet og forskellighed en styrke, og derfor er alle ansøgninger velkomne uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, civilstand etc.  

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet eller EWII som arbejdsplads, så kontakt endelig afdelingsleder, Jakob Linde, på tlf. 28 25 26 85. Du kan læse mere om os som virksomhed og arbejdsplads på ewii.dk. Er du mere nysgerrig, kan du også følge med ovre på LinkedIn, Facebook og Instagram. 

Stillingen besættes hurtigst muligt, og du kan søge den, så længe den er online på ewii.dk. Vi forventer at afholde de første samtaler i uge 32 og 33.


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…

  • Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
  • Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
  • Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
  • Can work both independently and as part of a team.

Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...

  • Python
  • PyTorch
  • C++
  • OpenCV
  • AWS
  • MLFlow
  • Kubernetes

We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...

  • Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
  • An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
  • Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
  • You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
  • Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
  • Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
  • Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.

Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Humlebæk, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Engineer or Data Scientist – do you want to become an AI Engineer?

Would you like to join us as we scale our AI team? You will be using your experience in bringing the right AI tools to the business to create value.

Join us as we identify the AI models and solutions, we configure to create a more effective business and ultimately make a difference to both people with intimate healthcare needs and healthcare professionals worldwide.

”Bringing your curiosity about AI and innovation to the table, you’ll get to work with the latest technology and make it come to life in an international company with a higher purpose,” says AI Lead, Simon Buemann.

A team dedicated to AI

Within Digital, Data and IT, you will be part of a relatively new AI team. The team is responsible for gathering and evaluating requirements for AI solutions from the entire business, creating roadmaps as well as identifying, configuring and developing the solutions into our setup.

“This area has a lot of interest from stakeholders across the business. We are working with brand new technology and contributing to innovation globally – and growing our team along the way,” explains Simon.

Deliver ethical and amazing AI solutions

With your team, your aim will be to deliver AI solutions that are aligned with Coloplast’s strategic goals and provide measurable business value. Throughout your work, it will be a priority to gather new knowledge on AI and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methodologies and practices.

Specifically, you will be delivering on our prioritised AI use cases in our roadmap to enhance operational efficiency and innovation. This covers all phases from refining business needs, developing solutions, setting up agents, configuring and grounding pre-built AI models, to testing and validation and finally creating documentation and supporting business roll-out. This also entails


Collaborating with team members, vendors, and business stakeholders from inception to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and alignment with the business requirements and expectations
Working with team members, other developers, and vendors to design, develop, test, and deploy AI solutions within Azure and other platforms that meet the technical and functional specifications
Ensuring that we implement sufficient test and documentation procedures
Collaborating with IT and software development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI capabilities
Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of the AI solutions, and providing recommendations for improvement and optimisation




Knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications

In this role, you need good people skills to explain complex AI concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences. Also, you have a strong sense of structure and quality, allowing you to test our AI models and make sure we create the best solutions.

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you


Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration
Are proficient in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments
Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, .Net or other relevant coding languages
Are familiar with access management and infrastructure as code
Have knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as natural language processing, GenAI, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Are fluent in English
Some travel might be required in connection with project workshops etc.




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply as we a looking to fill the positions by October 1st.

The positions will remain open until suitable candidates has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com.

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn. Like us on Facebook.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Grün, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

Title: Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline - Kalundborg
Description:
Attention all Process Engineers and Scientists! It is not unusual to look for a new challenge, whether you are an experienced professional or a newly graduated candidate, but in this role you will also have a chance to enhance skills and experience in data analysis, process systems, descriptive and prescriptive analytics, by joining the company as a Process Engineer or Scientist positions at our production teams in Kalundborg, where you can be a part of our mission to improve the lives of millions of patients worldwide.

Your new role

We are looking for Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analysing data for recommendations for improvements and development. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

Specifically, you will have day-to day tasks, such as:



Analysing large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
Examining and understanding data from quality control (QC) analyses.
Developing, maintaining, and recommending statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
Using a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
Utilizing a team-based approach for recommending process improvements-optimizations.
Handling deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
Writing and executing change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
Developing maintenance strategies to optimize running time.
Coordinating with other process owners in the department to ensure optimal production capacity at all times.
Taking part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.




These positions give you a great opportunity to play a part in shaping the future of manufacturing across the organization, in close collaboration with teach-transfer in Novo Nordisk.

We will match your profile with relevant roles depending on your level of experience and professional background. We work with positions that range from entry-level to senior process engineers and scientists.

Your new department

In CMC & Product Supply, we cover the full value chain from drug and device development to marketed Novo Nordisk products. We are more than 30,000 colleagues across the globe with the shared responsibility of scaling molecules, processes, devices, and products, dedicated to supplying life-saving medicines to the patients who need them most.

Your skills & qualifications for Process Engineer & Scientist roles

We are looking for Process Engineers or Scientists candidates that have the following qualifications:



Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
Ability to independently understand scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
Ability to monitor data and extract information.
An appetite for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
Professional proficiency in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.




For both Process Scientist & Engineer roles it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences and thereby, explain the purpose to get everyone onboard.

What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.

About Site Kalundborg

At Novo Nordisk manufacturing hub in Kalundborg, we are growing. From 2022-2029 we will invest 60 billion DKK to expand existing facilities for the current and future portfolio within serious chronic diseases. This will establish additional capacity across the entire global value chain from manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) to packaging, with the vast majority being invested in API capacity. With the investment, more than 1200 new jobs will be created. This is your opportunity to be part of our journey and help establish the future factories of Novo Nordisk.

Today, our 4,500 employees at Novo Nordisk Kalundborg produce half of the world’s insulin and a number of biopharmaceutical products, and we are never standing still. Together, we make a difference every day for more than 40 million people living with diabetes and other chronic diseases.

Our site is located a few minutes from the city, and just one stop with the train from the site. The train can also take you directly from the site to Copenhagen in around one hour.

Many newcomers find it easy to build a network of like-minded people coming from Denmark or internationals. Some can find a network through hobbies and sports, social network groups, colleagues or employees from other local businesses. Novo Nordisk Kalundborg

Apply and be matched to multiple job opportunities

When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Process Engineer & Scientist positions across CMC & Product Supply in site Kalundborg. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We’ll match your profile continuously with all suitable positions to ensure you don’t miss out on a life-changing career. This way you will automatically be considered as a potential match for all openings in the area across our factories.

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months, ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Looking for something different? We have multiple talent pipelines to offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by exploring our pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying



Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify a possible match between you and our open positions.
Please unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.




More information

If you have questions about these roles, you are welcome to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com.

Deadline

30 September 2025. (Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.)

Novo Nordisk is not your typical healthcare company. In a modern world of quick fixes, we focus on solutions to defeat serious chronic diseases and promote long-term health. Our unordinary mindset is at the heart of everything we do. We seek out new ideas and put people first as we push the boundaries of science, make healthcare more accessible, and treat, prevent, and even cure diseases that affect millions of lives. Because it takes an unordinary approach to drive real, lasting change in health.
