At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Generate prompts that challenge AI
  • Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
  • Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
  • You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Ruby
  • Code review experience is a must
  • Experience with AI projects is a plus
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Junior Data Analyst & Scientist – Bliv bindeleddet mellem data og forretning
Description:
Er du vild med data og nysgerrig på, hvordan tal og analyser kan skabe værdi i en virksomhed? Har du lyst til at kickstarte din karriere i en rolle, hvor du får lov at prøve kræfter med både analyse, samarbejde og forretningsforståelse? Så har vi måske jobbet til dig!

Lige nu leder vi efter en Junior Data Analyst til vores Marketing-team – en rolle, hvor du får masser af ansvar, læring og mulighed for at udvikle dig i krydsfeltet mellem forskellige afdelinger og stakeholders.

Hvad går jobbet ud på?

Du bliver en del af vores Marketing Data Insights-team, hvor vi hjælper forretningen med at træffe de rigtige beslutninger baseret på data. Du får chancen for at arbejde tæt sammen med både Product Marketing, Digital Marketing og andre nøglefunktioner.

Vi leder ikke efter én med mange års erfaring – vi leder efter dig, der har mod på at lære og har lyst til at bruge dine tekniske evner i en mere kommerciel kontekst. Vi sørger for, at du får den oplæring og sparring, du har brug for, så du kan vokse i rollen.

Når du er kommet godt ind i jobbet, vil du bl.a. arbejde med:


Supplier Management & Analyse: Understøtte Product Marketing med værktøjer, statistik og KPI-overvågning for vores leverandører. Du sikrer, at vi har styr på leverandørpræstationer, bonusberegninger og kontraktstatus.



Kampagneanalyse & Digital Marketing:

Evaluere og analysere marketingkampagner og bidrage med optimeringsforslag. Opbygge dashboards og datarutiner, der sikrer transparens og forbedret beslutningsgrundlag.


Projektledelse: Drive og koordinere projekter på tværs af Marketing og øvrige afdelinger, herunder budgetarbejde, sortimentsvalg og systemintegrationer.
Data & Systemudvikling: Være med til at videreudvikle og vedligeholde vores dataprocesser.



Hvem er du?

Du behøver ikke have mange års erfaring – det vigtigste for os er, at du:


Har en relevant uddannelse inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence eller lignende
Har arbejdet med SQL, Python eller lignende programmeringssprog og har et ønske om at blive endnu dygtigere på området
Har erfaring med databaser og Cloud (Google Cloud, Power BI eller lign.)
Har superbrugerkompetencer i Excel
Evt har erfaring med analyse, dataflows og performance management – gerne i en kommerciel kontekst
Er flydende engelsk i skrift og tale



Og vigtigst af alt: Du har lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vi tør prøve nyt, hjælper hinanden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Hvad får du hos os?


En plads i en international virksomhed.
Mulighed for både faglig og personlig udvikling.
Fantastiske kolleger og en stærk social kultur.
Svanemærket kantine og god kaffe.
Sundheds- og tandforsikring, pension og personaleforening.



Læs mere om os her

Klar til at tage det første skridt?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst, hvor du fortæller, hvorfor du vil arbejde hos os. Ansøgningsfristen er d. 18. august 2025.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Dennis Rømer Jensen, Head of Marketing Data Insights på telefon 23331102 eller e-mail dennis.jensen@lyreco.com. (ferie frem til 14. juli 2025.)

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hos Lyreco ønsker vi at fremme ligestilling og mangfoldighed. Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at søge – uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, religion, seksuel orientering eller handicap.

Lokation Roskilde


Show more

Lokation Roskilde

Title: Senior Scientist, Data-Driven Laboratory Automation, Hørsholm
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Senior Scientist

Become part of a passionate, forward-thinking team that is using innovative technology to shape the future of biosolutions. In this role, you will collaborate closely with colleagues across disciplines to develop digital solutions that advance our scientific capabilities. Projects may be individual or collaborative, but always focus on sharing knowledge, learning together, and delivering impactful results.

Welcome to Microbe and Culture Research

The Automation department is part of Microbe and Culture Research within R&D, which develops leads for new microbial products across various business areas within Novonesis. Here the Automation Department is responsible for supporting and developing reliable and scalable automation solutions.

The ultimate objective is to facilitate the efficient generation, capture, and storage of consistent high-quality data, enabling R&D to take data driven decisions for new product development. The Automation Department currently comprises 6 laboratory automation scientists and technicians with expertise in laboratory robotics, workflow automation, and digital automation.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By


Driving the advancement of our digital infrastructure to enable faster, data-driven decision-making for next-generation biological solutions.
Designing and deliver lightweight internal applications or APIs to provide researchers with “one-click” access to analyses, dashboards, and protocol metrics.
Developing and optimizing robust data pipelines with integrated quality checks and lineage tracking, ensuring seamless integration between our laboratories and data infrastructure.
Advocating for reproducible-science practices (e.g., version control, documentation, testing) and mentor on data best practices for data management and automation.


To Excel In This Position, You Should Bring


Educational background: A BSc or MSc in Biology, biotechnology, pharma, or similar field, with strong biological literacy.
3+ years of experience in data-engineering or backend software development roles
Experience with SQL and relational-model design, and building ETL/ELT pipelines
Strong cross-disciplinary communication skills to collaborate effectively with biologists, data engineers, and IT professionals.
A mindset for balancing autonomy and ownership of projects with a collaborative mindset, finding fulfillment in solving problems while mentoring and upskilling colleagues to drive collective success.


It Is Preferred If You Also Come With


Experience in designing and building intuitive user interfaces that enhance usability.
Familiarity with industry-standard tools like LIMS/ELN systems (e.g., Benchling) that streamline workflows.


Location: Hørsholm, Denmark

Application deadline: 4th of August 2025. We will screen applications and invite for interviews after the deadline.

Contact details: If you have any questions, you are more than welcome to reach out to Jérémy Armetta, Senior Scientist, on jyar@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.

Title: IOT Cloud Developer
Description:
Role Description

We’re looking for an IoT Cloud Developer to join our growing team — someone who thrives on connecting devices to the cloud and designing scalable, secure, and efficient back-end systems.

You’ll be part of a small software department and a multidisciplinary team to take IoT products from concept to reality. While you understand the embedded world, your passion lies in the cloud — designing data pipelines, APIs, dashboards, and backend infrastructure to handle device communication, data storage, and user interaction.

This is a hands-on, on-site role with architectural responsibility. You’ll help define the cloud side of our solutions, mentor other team members, and ensure we’re building platforms that can scale, adapt, and perform.




About You

You enjoy seeing the full picture of an IoT system — from sensors to dashboards — and know how to build the cloud half of that bridge.
You’re comfortable taking ownership of architecture and long-term decisions.
You appreciate tight-knit collaboration with embedded developers and have a basic understanding of embedded systems.
You value simplicity, security, and future-proofing in your solutions.
You're excited to be part of a small, experienced team and shape how cloud development is done at Move Innovation.




Qualifications

Solid experience building cloud-based applications for IoT or connected devices
Experience with Cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Strong system-level thinking
Proven ability to design software architecture
Software Debugging and Design abilities
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field




Skills

Backend Programming – Python, Node.js, Go, or similar languages
IoT Communication Protocols – MQTT, HTTP, WebSockets, and CoAP
API Development and Integration – Designing and consuming RESTful APIs
Database Technologies – Experience with SQL and NoSQL for structured and unstructured data
Data Processing and Visualization – Working with time-series databases
Grafana – Real-time monitoring and dashboard creation
DevOps and Deployment – CI/CD, cloud infrastructure automation
Security and Identity Management – Secure communication, encryption, and authentication in IoT systems
Embedded System Interfacing – Understanding of basic hardware interfaces like UART, SPI, and I2C
Version Control Systems – Git
Containerization and Virtualization – Using Docker (and optionally Kubernetes) for cloud service deployment




The perks

Adjustable work hours
Opportunity for pension and health insurance
Lunch in a canteen offering healthy and varied meals
Participate in rich social activities arranged by our party committee




Company Description

Move Innovation is a small development company with 15 developers based in the Copenhagen Metropolitan Area, specializing in product development since 2010. Our services range from electronics and mechanics to software and system integration. Whether it’s complex hardware designs or a medtech product with strict regulatory requirements, we have the experts in-house. This means we always deliver solutions that work and can identify challenges before they become problems. In short: We know how technology works in the real world — and how to bring a product to market.




If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact CEO Jacob Hesselballe (+45-40956894 or jh@moveinnovation.dk)

Show more

Title: Front End Developers - AI Training [Remote]
Description:
This is a great opportunity to supplement your income while looking for longer or more full-time work, all while contributing to the development of new AI models using your domain expertise!

Our client has hired over 1,000 Braintrust talent and intends to hire hundreds more!

Many Braintrust coders earn over $12,000 per month!

You’ll have the flexibility to work as much or as little as you choose - 20hrs/week is suggested, but not a limit. Start working in as little as 48 hours. Your final hourly rate will be chosen by Outlier AI and determined by your location.

What to expect: If qualified, you’ll be invited to complete a brief questionnaire that takes 3-5 minutes. If you successfully pass the questionnaire, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP.

Required qualifications:

Proficiency working one of the following languages: Swift, Python, Java, Go, Verilog, Javascript, C++, or C#

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.

Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.

Note: Outlier AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity

What You’ll Be Working On

Our client has partnered with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code.

Example projects might include:
Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Optimize code to run at maximum efficiency
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
Writing human-readable summaries of coding problems
Writing explanations of how code can solve problems and evaluate various solution approaches

No previous experience with AI necessary! You will receive detailed instructions on what is expected of you after you complete the application and verification process.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Om stillingen

Hos Krifa bliver du som Data Scientist en del af et ambitiøst og tværfagligt team, der fungerer som interne specialister / konsulenter i udviklingen af AI-løsninger med konkret værdi for vores medlemmer og forretning. Vi tror på, at de bedste resultater skabes i tæt samarbejde med forretningen, hvor forskellige kompetencer bringes i spil.







Vi søger 1-2 nye kolleger til at styrke vores tekniske fundament. Som supplement til dine primære kvalifikationer som data scientist, ser vi gerne, at du i tillæg har erfaring inden for ét af to specifikke områder:

Cloud & MLOps/DevOps: Du er en Data Scientist, der brænder for at bygge robuste og skalerbare systemer. Du bygger bro mellem modeludvikling og implementering ved at designe og automatisere de pipelines, der sikrer, at vores løsninger kan leveres effektivt.
Data Engineering: Du er en Data Scientist, der motiveres af at skabe orden og bygge det solide datafundament, som al god AI hviler på. Du trives med at designe datamodeller og etablere effektive data-pipelines af høj kvalitet til hvert enkelt projekt.




Det afgørende er ikke en rigid rollefordeling, men at vi som team deler en passion for at løfte opgaverne i flok og tilsammen dækker de nødvendige kompetencer.







Dine arbejdsopgaver i teamet

Du bliver en del af et team, hvor alle bidrager på tværs af værdikæden. Sammen arbejder vi med:

Data Science & AI Engineering: At omsætte både strukturerede og ustrukturerede data til indsigter. Dette indebærer analyse af komplekse datasæt og udvikling af machine learning-modeller inden for alt fra predictive analytics til NLP samt udvikling af AI agenter, RAG, MCP-servere mm.
Automatisering af processer: At identificere og automatisere forretningsprocesser og manuelle arbejdsgange med data og AI for at skabe effektivitet og frigøre tid i organisationen.
Datafundament og Engineering: At bygge og vedligeholde det datagrundlag, vores løsninger kører på. Her bliver dine kompetencer inden for Data Engineering afgørende for vores succes med at designe datamodeller, bygge ETL/ELT-pipelines og sikre høj datakvalitet.
Operationalisering (MLOps/DevOps): At sikre, at vores modeller kan udrulles og integreres effektivt i Krifas systemer. Med din erfaring inden for MLOps/DevOps styrker du teamets evne til at bygge CI/CD-pipelines til deployment, automatisere monitorering og designe en skalerbar cloud-infrastruktur (f.eks. Azure) til vores løsninger.
Arkitektur og Samarbejde: At bidrage til den overordnede tekniske arkitektur i tæt sparring med resten af teamet, så vi træffer bæredygtige teknologivalg for fremtiden.







Hvem er du?

Du har stærke analytiske evner og en teknisk profil, som du formår at omsætte til konkrete løsninger. Du er nysgerrig, proaktiv og trives i et miljø, hvor der er fokus på både innovation og leverancen af robuste løsninger. Frem for alt har du lyst til at være med til at forme fremtidens AI-løsninger i Krifa som en del af et passioneret team.







Vi forestiller os, at du har:

Solid praktisk erfaring med AI, LLM'er og ML, gerne med både strukturerede data og ustrukturerede data.
Stærke programmeringskompetencer i Python, da det er vores primære sprog for data science.
Erfaring med enten Data Engineering (ETL, databaser, data lakes / lakehouses som f.eks. Microsoft Fabric eller Databricks) eller Cloud & DevOps (Azure/AWS/GCP, CI/CD, IaC). Du behøver ikke være ekspert i begge dele.
Evnen til at samarbejde med både tekniske og ikke-tekniske kolleger og omsætte data til forretningsværdi.
Flydende dansk er et krav – både mundtligt og skriftligt







Om Krifa

Du bliver en del af en moderne arbejdslivsbevægelse med mere end 185.000 medlemmer. Krifa er kåret som Danmarks bedste a-kasse de seneste tre år, og vores medlemmer oplever, at de bliver mødt med empati og forståelse. Vi ved at dygtige og glade medarbejderne skaber de bedste resultater. Derfor gør vi en dyd ud af at skabe en arbejdsplads, hvor du både kan udvikle dig og får ansvar fra dag ét.

I Aarhus N sidder 300 medarbejdere. Udover en god udsigt har vi fantastiske rammer: lækre lokaler, restaurantordning, attraktive arbejdsforhold samt gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling. Læs mere om os på www.krifa.dk/karriere




Vi glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning og høre mere om, hvordan du kan bidrage til vores team og organisation!







Hvis du vil vide mere

Kontakt AI chef Lars Ørnholt Kier på 21642185 eller loek@krifa.dk (træffes ikke i uge 28-30) eller Lead Data Scientist Jonas Dreyøe Herfort på 21424071 eller jdht@krifa.dk (træffes ikke i uge 27-29).







Ansøgningsfrist: Søg stillingen hurtigst muligt - dog senest 24. august

Arbejdssted: Klokhøjen 4, 8200 Aarhus N

Arbejdstid: Fuldtid

Tiltrædelse: Hurtigst muligt efter aftale

Show more
HTML:
Om stillingen

Hos Krifa bliver du som Data Scientist en del af et ambitiøst og tværfagligt team, der fungerer som interne specialister / konsulenter i udviklingen af AI-løsninger med konkret værdi for vores medlemmer og forretning. Vi tror på, at de bedste resultater skabes i tæt samarbejde med forretningen, hvor forskellige kompetencer bringes i spil.



Vi søger 1-2 nye kolleger til at styrke vores tekniske fundament. Som supplement til dine primære kvalifikationer som data scientist, ser vi gerne, at du i tillæg har erfaring inden for ét af to specifikke områder:

  • Cloud & MLOps/DevOps: Du er en Data Scientist, der brænder for at bygge robuste og skalerbare systemer. Du bygger bro mellem modeludvikling og implementering ved at designe og automatisere de pipelines, der sikrer, at vores løsninger kan leveres effektivt.
  • Data Engineering: Du er en Data Scientist, der motiveres af at skabe orden og bygge det solide datafundament, som al god AI hviler på. Du trives med at designe datamodeller og etablere effektive data-pipelines af høj kvalitet til hvert enkelt projekt.


Det afgørende er ikke en rigid rollefordeling, men at vi som team deler en passion for at løfte opgaverne i flok og tilsammen dækker de nødvendige kompetencer.

Title: Internship GEN AI
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about Generative AI and ready to dive into the world of Gen AI to help transform one of the most iconic brands globally?

Then buckle up and get yourself energized for a 5–6-month internship journey, where you will bring your passion for AI and innovation, along with your technical skills, to shape the future of Generative AI at The LEGO Group. Collaborate with experts to develop cutting-edge tools, strategies, and solutions that will empower our organization and engage our community in new and exciting ways.


Core Responsibilities

Our full-time internship will run for 5-6 months, and you will become an integrated member of the team. Your task will include but not be limited to





Assist the development and maintenance of the GenAI Developer Toolbox.
Support team members on ongoing projects by conducting research and data analysis
Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for improvement
Help create and maintain documentation for processes and procedures
Collaborate with other interns and staff to complete assigned tasks and projects
Perform administrative tasks as needed to support team objectives




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will become a part of the Gen AI team that enables the Digital Technology organization to design and implement GenAI solutions.

We're on a mission to make Generative AI (GenAI) accessible across our entire organization. Our team is also responsible for building and evolving our internal GenAI platform that powers innovation from within. You'll become part of a dynamic team of over 10 talented professionals with diverse backgrounds in software engineering, design, and data science. With colleagues from six different nationalities, we value diversity and collaboration in everything we do.

This role is based in our brand-new Digital Office in Copenhagen – a vibrant, inspiring, and flexible workspace designed to spark creativity, collaboration, and, of course, some of fun too!

As an intern at the LEGO Group, you are invited to join our Student Worker and Intern’s community in Denmark organizing fun, energizing and social events for you to meet fellow student colleagues sharing a similar experience to yours. Read more about our student community, benefits and available facilities here https //www.lego.com/en-es/careers/early-careers-dk

Do you have what it takes?

You are currently enrolled in a higher educational institution and are able to take on an internship for 5-6 months. You could come from multiple educational backgrounds such as the field of Software development or similar engineering fields. Moreover you have experience and knowledge with Python, typescript or other programming languages and are familiar with Generative AI and its applications.

Furthermore, in order to succeed in this role, you will demonstrate





Collaborative mindset and willingness to support the team
Strong organizational skills, detail oriented and outcome focused
Confidence, proactivity, and ability to work autonomously
Strong team spirit
Proficiency in English language skills




There is no relocation assistance for this specific position.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Humlebæk, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Engineer or Data Scientist – do you want to become an AI Engineer?

Would you like to join us as we scale our AI team? You will be using your experience in bringing the right AI tools to the business to create value.

Join us as we identify the AI models and solutions, we configure to create a more effective business and ultimately make a difference to both people with intimate healthcare needs and healthcare professionals worldwide.

”Bringing your curiosity about AI and innovation to the table, you’ll get to work with the latest technology and make it come to life in an international company with a higher purpose,” says AI Lead, Simon Buemann.

A team dedicated to AI

Within Digital, Data and IT, you will be part of a relatively new AI team. The team is responsible for gathering and evaluating requirements for AI solutions from the entire business, creating roadmaps as well as identifying, configuring and developing the solutions into our setup.

“This area has a lot of interest from stakeholders across the business. We are working with brand new technology and contributing to innovation globally – and growing our team along the way,” explains Simon.

Deliver ethical and amazing AI solutions

With your team, your aim will be to deliver AI solutions that are aligned with Coloplast’s strategic goals and provide measurable business value. Throughout your work, it will be a priority to gather new knowledge on AI and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methodologies and practices.

Specifically, you will be delivering on our prioritised AI use cases in our roadmap to enhance operational efficiency and innovation. This covers all phases from refining business needs, developing solutions, setting up agents, configuring and grounding pre-built AI models, to testing and validation and finally creating documentation and supporting business roll-out. This also entails


Collaborating with team members, vendors, and business stakeholders from inception to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and alignment with the business requirements and expectations
Working with team members, other developers, and vendors to design, develop, test, and deploy AI solutions within Azure and other platforms that meet the technical and functional specifications
Ensuring that we implement sufficient test and documentation procedures
Collaborating with IT and software development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI capabilities
Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of the AI solutions, and providing recommendations for improvement and optimisation




Knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications

In this role, you need good people skills to explain complex AI concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences. Also, you have a strong sense of structure and quality, allowing you to test our AI models and make sure we create the best solutions.

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you


Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration
Are proficient in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments
Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, .Net or other relevant coding languages
Are familiar with access management and infrastructure as code
Have knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as natural language processing, GenAI, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Are fluent in English
Some travel might be required in connection with project workshops etc.




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply as we a looking to fill the positions by October 1st.

The positions will remain open until suitable candidates has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com.

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn. Like us on Facebook.

Title: Unsolicited job application
Place: Sønderborg Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Saab, we offer career prospects. We are well aware that the choice is therefore sometimes not easy.

But you know best what you are looking for and how you imagine your dream job to be.

Thus, before you use the opportunity to send us an unsolicited application, we kindly ask you to take a look at our job portal. The available filter options in our job list will help you to find the position you are looking for.

About Us

At Saab, we're always on the lookout for passionate, talented individuals who are eager to make a difference.

Why Submit an Unsolicited Application?

We understand that talent doesn't always fit into predefined roles or job descriptions. By submitting an unsolicited application, you have the opportunity to showcase your unique skills and experiences that could bring new perspectives and value to our team. Whether you're an experienced professional or a recent graduate, we want to hear from you!

How To Apply

Prepare Your Application:

Cover Letter: Introduce yourself and explain why you’re interested in joining our team.

Resume/CV: Provide a detailed overview of your work experience, education, and skills.

What To Expect

Once we receive your application, our HR team will review your materials and consider how your skills and experiences could fit within our organization. If there's a potential match, we'll reach out to you for further discussions. While we can’t guarantee immediate openings, we value every application and keep them on file for future opportunities.

Title: Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline - Kalundborg
Description:
Attention all Process Engineers and Scientists! It is not unusual to look for a new challenge, whether you are an experienced professional or a newly graduated candidate, but in this role you will also have a chance to enhance skills and experience in data analysis, process systems, descriptive and prescriptive analytics, by joining the company as a Process Engineer or Scientist positions at our production teams in Kalundborg, where you can be a part of our mission to improve the lives of millions of patients worldwide.

Your new role

We are looking for Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analysing data for recommendations for improvements and development. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

Specifically, you will have day-to day tasks, such as:



Analysing large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
Examining and understanding data from quality control (QC) analyses.
Developing, maintaining, and recommending statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
Using a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
Utilizing a team-based approach for recommending process improvements-optimizations.
Handling deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
Writing and executing change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
Developing maintenance strategies to optimize running time.
Coordinating with other process owners in the department to ensure optimal production capacity at all times.
Taking part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.




These positions give you a great opportunity to play a part in shaping the future of manufacturing across the organization, in close collaboration with teach-transfer in Novo Nordisk.

We will match your profile with relevant roles depending on your level of experience and professional background. We work with positions that range from entry-level to senior process engineers and scientists.

Your new department

In CMC & Product Supply, we cover the full value chain from drug and device development to marketed Novo Nordisk products. We are more than 30,000 colleagues across the globe with the shared responsibility of scaling molecules, processes, devices, and products, dedicated to supplying life-saving medicines to the patients who need them most.

Your skills & qualifications for Process Engineer & Scientist roles

We are looking for Process Engineers or Scientists candidates that have the following qualifications:



Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
Ability to independently understand scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
Ability to monitor data and extract information.
An appetite for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
Professional proficiency in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.




For both Process Scientist & Engineer roles it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences and thereby, explain the purpose to get everyone onboard.

What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.

About Site Kalundborg

At Novo Nordisk manufacturing hub in Kalundborg, we are growing. From 2022-2029 we will invest 60 billion DKK to expand existing facilities for the current and future portfolio within serious chronic diseases. This will establish additional capacity across the entire global value chain from manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) to packaging, with the vast majority being invested in API capacity. With the investment, more than 1200 new jobs will be created. This is your opportunity to be part of our journey and help establish the future factories of Novo Nordisk.

Today, our 4,500 employees at Novo Nordisk Kalundborg produce half of the world’s insulin and a number of biopharmaceutical products, and we are never standing still. Together, we make a difference every day for more than 40 million people living with diabetes and other chronic diseases.

Our site is located a few minutes from the city, and just one stop with the train from the site. The train can also take you directly from the site to Copenhagen in around one hour.

Many newcomers find it easy to build a network of like-minded people coming from Denmark or internationals. Some can find a network through hobbies and sports, social network groups, colleagues or employees from other local businesses. Novo Nordisk Kalundborg

Apply and be matched to multiple job opportunities

When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Process Engineer & Scientist positions across CMC & Product Supply in site Kalundborg. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We’ll match your profile continuously with all suitable positions to ensure you don’t miss out on a life-changing career. This way you will automatically be considered as a potential match for all openings in the area across our factories.

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months, ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Looking for something different? We have multiple talent pipelines to offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by exploring our pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying



Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify a possible match between you and our open positions.
Please unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.




More information

If you have questions about these roles, you are welcome to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com.

Deadline

30 September 2025. (Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.)

Novo Nordisk is not your typical healthcare company. In a modern world of quick fixes, we focus on solutions to defeat serious chronic diseases and promote long-term health. Our unordinary mindset is at the heart of everything we do. We seek out new ideas and put people first as we push the boundaries of science, make healthcare more accessible, and treat, prevent, and even cure diseases that affect millions of lives. Because it takes an unordinary approach to drive real, lasting change in health.
Show more

Title: Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline - Greater Copenhagen Area & Hillerød
Description:
Calling all experienced Process Engineers and Scientists! It is not unusual to bring skills and experience to a team that aims to improve lives of millions of patients worldwide, but in this role you can also upgrade your experience in working with data analysis, process systems, descriptive and prescriptive analytics by joining one of our many production sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area or Hillerød, Denmark as our next Experienced Process Engineer or Scientist!

Your new role

We are looking for Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analyzing data for recommendations and improvements. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

Specifically, you have several years of professional experience in day-to-day tasks such as:



Analyzing large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
Working and understanding data from Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA).
Developing, maintaining, and recommending statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
Utilizing a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
Operating in a team-based approach for recommending process improvements and optimizations.
Handling deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
Writing and executing change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
Developing maintenance strategies to optimize running time.
Coordinating with other process owners in the department to ensure optimal production capacity at all times.
Taking part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.




In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop and enhance your professional and personal skills while shaping the future of manufacturing across our organization, in close collaboration with other colleagues in Novo Nordisk.

Your new department

In CMC & Product Supply, we cover the full value chain from drug and device development to marketed Novo Nordisk products. We are more than 30,000 colleagues across the globe with the shared responsibility of scaling molecules, processes, devices, and products, dedicated to supplying life-saving medicines to the patients who need them most.

Your Skills And Qualifications

We are looking for Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists candidates that have the following qualifications:



Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
Understanding of scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
Ability to monitor data and extract information independently.
Curiosity for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
Appetite for solving complex problems is applied to a systematic approach to managing complexity and reaching feasible applicable solutions.
Professional proficiency in verbal and written English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.




For Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists, it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences, so we get everyone on board. In this role you will collaborate with different departments and have a broad landscape of stakeholders.

We also welcome and encourage early talent to apply for our pipelines, as we are committed to fostering growth and development in our employees and providing opportunities for long-term career success, and we encourage you to apply for our Junior Process Engineer & Scientists Pipeline instead: Junior Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline.



About The Greater Copenhagen Area

We have many different sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area: in Bagsværd, Gentofte, Kirke Værløse, Køge, Lyngby, Søborg and Måløv, so remember to clearly state which locations you are interested in applying to.

About Site Hillerød

Site Hillerød is an innovative and fast-growing production site. With over 4,000 talented employees, we work together to drive change for people living with serious chronic diseases. The site is in beautiful natural surroundings, and we offer a diverse array of career paths at all educational levels. Join our vibrant community at Site Hillerød and ramp up your career while we ramp up our production! Get to know us better - visit our Site Hillerød career page.

Novo Nordisk Hillerød

What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.

Apply and be matched with multiple job opportunities

When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Experienced and Senior Process Engineer & Scientist positions across CMC & Product Supply in the locations where you have shown interest in. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your application, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We continuously match your profile with all suitable positions to ensure that you don't miss out on any life-changing career opportunities. This means that you will automatically be considered for all openings in the area across our factories. Don't wait any longer to take the next step in your career - apply now and let us help you find the perfect match!

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months, ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Looking for something different? We have multiple talent pipelines to offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by exploring our pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying



Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify a possible match between you and our open positions.
Unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.




More information

If you have questions about these roles, you are welcome to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com.

Deadline

30 September 2025. (Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.)

Novo Nordisk is not your typical healthcare company. In a modern world of quick fixes, we focus on solutions to defeat serious chronic diseases and promote long-term health. Our unordinary mindset is at the heart of everything we do. We seek out new ideas and put people first as we push the boundaries of science, make healthcare more accessible, and treat, prevent, and even cure diseases that affect millions of lives. Because it takes an unordinary approach to drive real, lasting change in health.

Title: Data Scientist med AI/ML-fokus til EWIIs Digitale Kundeplatforme
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hvem er vi?

Vi er en energikoncern der leverer vand og fjernvarme i trekantområdet samt el, bredbånd og ladeløsninger til kunder i hele Danmark. Vi har inden for de seneste år udskiftet alle vores digitale kundevendte platforme, og har nu en stærk digital tilstedeværelse med vores hjemmeside, flere selvbetjeningsløsninger, mobilapps og en marketing automation platform. Platformene er integrerede med hinanden og bygget på en moderne og prisbelønnet integrationsplatform, hvor data er gjort tilgængelige via microservices.

I Digitale Kundeplatforme drifter og videreudvikler vi platformene i tæt samarbejde med andre forretningsområder og vores eget tilknyttede IT-udviklingsteam. Vi er allerede i gang med at implementere databaserede løsninger, som en del af vores digitale kundeoplevelser, og ønsker nu at tage næste skridt og sætte fart på udviklingen.

Om rollen

Du bliver teamets specialist i machine learning og AI og får ansvar for at udvikle, teste og implementere modeller, der udgør det datamæssige fundament for nye digitale løsninger og services til vores kunder.

Du kommer til at arbejde hands-on med modellering, databehandling og kode – i tæt samspil med relevante afdelinger såsom IT-infrastruktur, Data Warehouse og Data Governance. Derudover vil du arbejde sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet, der arbejder med app, web, selvbetjening og marketing automation, om at integrere modellerne direkte i vores digitale platforme og løsninger, så de skaber reel værdi for vores kunder.

Hos EWII arbejder andre data scientists med forskellige formål på tværs af organisationen, og vi har allerede et stærkt teknologi- og datasetup på plads. I denne rolle får du ansvar for at udvikle modeller baseret på kundernes forbrugs- og adfærdsdata – kombineret med relevante tredjepartsdata såsom vejr- og boligdata.

Eksempler på arbejdsopgaver



Udvikling og optimering af prædiktive og præskriptive modeller, som danner udgangspunkt for vores automatiserede kommunikation
Udvikling og optimering af forbrugsalarmer baseret på machine learning og anomalidetektion, som automatisk kan opdage, hvis den enkelte kundes forbrug afviger fra deres normalforbrug
Udvikling af personaliserede forbrugsrapporter baseret på dataanalyse og integreret med generativt AI, som genererer individuelle rapporter med grafer og forklarende tekst.
Udforske nye teknologier og eksperimentere med ML- og AI-baserede løsninger på tværs af platformene.



Det tilbyder vi 

Som medarbejder i EWII er det ikke kun dit arbejde, der er i centrum - du får også mange personalegoder, der er værd at arbejde for. Hvilke goder, du kan nyde godt af, kan du blive klogere på her. 

Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du har en uddannelse inden for datalogi, machine learning, statistik eller lignende – fx cand.scient., cand.polyt. eller cand.it med specialisering i data science. Du har allerede nogen erfaring, og har et ønske om at arbejde tættere sammen med forretningen om dine modeller.

Vi lægger vægt på, at du:



Har praktisk erfaring med dataanalyse, statistisk modellering og machine learning i cloud-baserede miljøer, herunder udvikling af prædiktive og preskriptive modeller på Azure Databricks-platformen.
Har stærke kompetencer inden for Python og SQL.
Forstår, hvordan modeller omsættes til værdi i en digital forretningskontekst og gerne i forbindelse med digitale kundevendte platforme.
Trives i krydsfeltet mellem teknik og forretning og kan forklare komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer
Er nysgerrig, forretningsorienteret og trives med et stort selvstændigt ansvar for dit ansvarsområde, men sætter pris på at arbejde teamorienteret mod vores fælles vision og mål.



I rollen får du



En central rolle i et ambitiøst digitalt team med stærkt mandat og stor indflydelse.
Frihed til at eksperimentere og udvikle dine egne idéer til ML- og AI-baserede kundeløsninger
Samarbejde med kollegaer, der arbejder med digital performance, UX, app- og webudvikling, marketing automation og dataplatforme
Adgang til en moderne teknologistak samtidig med, at du bliver en del af en virksomhed med strategisk fokus på digital innovation.



Sæt et grønt fodspor sammen med os 

I EWII er hverdagen vidt forskellig for vores 700 medarbejdere. Men fælles for alle er, at fagligheden når helt ud i fingerspidserne – og den skal male fremtiden grøn. 

I EWIIs kommercielle afdelinger kridter vi kondiskoene hver dag – uanset om vi lægger arm med energimarkedet, digitaliserer forretningen eller flytter danskerne over på fiber. Sammen gør vi det, der er sort til grøn business – til gavn for miljø, kunder og bundlinje. 

Er du vores nye kollega?

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig. Du sender sit CV og motiverede ansøgning ved at klikke på ansøgningsknappen. Hos os er diversitet og forskellighed en styrke, og derfor er alle ansøgninger velkomne uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, civilstand etc.  

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet eller EWII som arbejdsplads, så kontakt endelig afdelingsleder, Jakob Linde, på tlf. 28 25 26 85. Du kan læse mere om os som virksomhed og arbejdsplads på ewii.dk. Er du mere nysgerrig, kan du også følge med ovre på LinkedIn, Facebook og Instagram. 

Stillingen besættes hurtigst muligt, og du kan søge den, så længe den er online på ewii.dk. Vi forventer at afholde de første samtaler i uge 32 og 33.


Show more
HTML:
Hvem er vi?

Vi er en energikoncern der leverer vand og fjernvarme i trekantområdet samt el, bredbånd og ladeløsninger til kunder i hele Danmark. Vi har inden for de seneste år udskiftet alle vores digitale kundevendte platforme, og har nu en stærk digital tilstedeværelse med vores hjemmeside, flere selvbetjeningsløsninger, mobilapps og en marketing automation platform. Platformene er integrerede med hinanden og bygget på en moderne og prisbelønnet integrationsplatform, hvor data er gjort tilgængelige via microservices.

I Digitale Kundeplatforme drifter og videreudvikler vi platformene i tæt samarbejde med andre forretningsområder og vores eget tilknyttede IT-udviklingsteam. Vi er allerede i gang med at implementere databaserede løsninger, som en del af vores digitale kundeoplevelser, og ønsker nu at tage næste skridt og sætte fart på udviklingen.

Om rollen

Du bliver teamets specialist i machine learning og AI og får ansvar for at udvikle, teste og implementere modeller, der udgør det datamæssige fundament for nye digitale løsninger og services til vores kunder.

Du kommer til at arbejde hands-on med modellering, databehandling og kode – i tæt samspil med relevante afdelinger såsom IT-infrastruktur, Data Warehouse og Data Governance. Derudover vil du arbejde sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet, der arbejder med app, web, selvbetjening og marketing automation, om at integrere modellerne direkte i vores digitale platforme og løsninger, så de skaber reel værdi for vores kunder.

Hos EWII arbejder andre data scientists med forskellige formål på tværs af organisationen, og vi har allerede et stærkt teknologi- og datasetup på plads. I denne rolle får du ansvar for at udvikle modeller baseret på kundernes forbrugs- og adfærdsdata – kombineret med relevante tredjepartsdata såsom vejr- og boligdata.

Eksempler på arbejdsopgaver


  • Udvikling og optimering af prædiktive og præskriptive modeller, som danner udgangspunkt for vores automatiserede kommunikation
  • Udvikling og optimering af forbrugsalarmer baseret på machine learning og anomalidetektion, som automatisk kan opdage, hvis den enkelte kundes forbrug afviger fra deres normalforbrug
  • Udvikling af personaliserede forbrugsrapporter baseret på dataanalyse og integreret med generativt AI, som genererer individuelle rapporter med grafer og forklarende tekst.
  • Udforske nye teknologier og eksperimentere med ML- og AI-baserede løsninger på tværs af platformene.


Det tilbyder vi 

Som medarbejder i EWII er det ikke kun dit arbejde, der er i centrum - du får også mange personalegoder, der er værd at arbejde for. Hvilke goder, du kan nyde godt af, kan du blive klogere på her. 

Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du har en uddannelse inden for datalogi, machine learning, statistik eller lignende – fx cand.scient., cand.polyt. eller cand.it med specialisering i data science. Du har allerede nogen erfaring, og har et ønske om at arbejde tættere sammen med forretningen om dine modeller.

Vi lægger vægt på, at du:


  • Har praktisk erfaring med dataanalyse, statistisk modellering og machine learning i cloud-baserede miljøer, herunder udvikling af prædiktive og preskriptive modeller på Azure Databricks-platformen.
  • Har stærke kompetencer inden for Python og SQL.
  • Forstår, hvordan modeller omsættes til værdi i en digital forretningskontekst og gerne i forbindelse med digitale kundevendte platforme.
  • Trives i krydsfeltet mellem teknik og forretning og kan forklare komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer
  • Er nysgerrig, forretningsorienteret og trives med et stort selvstændigt ansvar for dit ansvarsområde, men sætter pris på at arbejde teamorienteret mod vores fælles vision og mål.


I rollen får du


  • En central rolle i et ambitiøst digitalt team med stærkt mandat og stor indflydelse.
  • Frihed til at eksperimentere og udvikle dine egne idéer til ML- og AI-baserede kundeløsninger
  • Samarbejde med kollegaer, der arbejder med digital performance, UX, app- og webudvikling, marketing automation og dataplatforme
  • Adgang til en moderne teknologistak samtidig med, at du bliver en del af en virksomhed med strategisk fokus på digital innovation.


Sæt et grønt fodspor sammen med os 

I EWII er hverdagen vidt forskellig for vores 700 medarbejdere. Men fælles for alle er, at fagligheden når helt ud i fingerspidserne – og den skal male fremtiden grøn. 

I EWIIs kommercielle afdelinger kridter vi kondiskoene hver dag – uanset om vi lægger arm med energimarkedet, digitaliserer forretningen eller flytter danskerne over på fiber. Sammen gør vi det, der er sort til grøn business – til gavn for miljø, kunder og bundlinje. 

Er du vores nye kollega?

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig. Du sender sit CV og motiverede ansøgning ved at klikke på ansøgningsknappen. Hos os er diversitet og forskellighed en styrke, og derfor er alle ansøgninger velkomne uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, civilstand etc.  

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet eller EWII som arbejdsplads, så kontakt endelig afdelingsleder, Jakob Linde, på tlf. 28 25 26 85. Du kan læse mere om os som virksomhed og arbejdsplads på ewii.dk. Er du mere nysgerrig, kan du også følge med ovre på LinkedIn, Facebook og Instagram. 

Stillingen besættes hurtigst muligt, og du kan søge den, så længe den er online på ewii.dk. Vi forventer at afholde de første samtaler i uge 32 og 33.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Scientific Data Architect - Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

TetraScience is the Scientific Data and AI Cloud company. We are catalyzing the Scientific AI revolution by designing and industrializing AI-native scientific data sets, which we bring to life in a growing suite of next gen lab data management solutions, scientific use cases, and AI-enabled outcomes.

TetraScience is the category leader in this vital new market, generating more revenue than all other companies in the aggregate. In the last year alone, the world's dominant players in compute, cloud, data, and AI infrastructure have converged on TetraScience as the de facto standard, entering into co-innovation and go-to-market partnerships: Latest News and Announcements | TetraScience Newsroom:

In connection with your candidacy, you will be asked to carefully review the Tetra Way letter, authored directly by Patrick Grady, our co-founder and CEO. This letter is designed to assist you in better understanding whether TetraScience is the right fit for you from a values and ethos perspective.

It is impossible to overstate the importance of this document and you are encouraged to take it literally and reflect on whether you are aligned with our unique approach to company and team building. If you join us, you will be expected to embody its contents each day.

Who You Are

You are a product-minded, outcome-obsessed driver of technical scientific solutions.

You a high velocity self-starter. You refuse to let uncertainty obstruct your path to designing and building solutions.

You roll up your sleeves, try things out, and get things done. You do not hesitate to prototype, demo, and build in order to accelerate delivery of products for your end users.

You thrive in environments where you can collaborate with scientists, product managers, and engineers to transform complex scientific data into actionable outcomes. Your ability to engage with scientists and business leaders alike makes you a key player in maximizing the value of scientific data.

With rich experience applying cutting edge data methodologies to the biopharma R&D domain, you bridge understanding between present-day pain points and generalizable solutions.

You are an insatiable learner, with a track record of deeply learning new tools, methods, and domains.

You fundamentally embody the principles of extreme ownership and have a demonstrated history of building extensible data models and applications for Biopharma end users to maximize value from their data via analysis and integration with AI/ML.

This role will require extreme self-discipline and determination as we forge a category that will fundamentally and forever change the life science industry.

What You Have Done


PhD with 7+ years / Masters with 10+ years of industry experience in life sciences with extensive domain knowledge in drug discovery (target ID through lead optimization), preclinical development, CMC (all drug modalities), or product quality testing
Proven track record of defining, designing, prototyping, and implementing productized AI/ML-driven use cases in cloud environments
Collaborated with cross-functional teams, including product managers, software engineers, and scientific stakeholders
Performed extensive exploratory data analysis and workflow optimization to enable scientific outcomes not previously possible
Engaged diverse audiences, from scientists to executive stakeholders using your excellent communication and storytelling abilities
Advised scientists in a consulting capacity to further research, development, and quality testing outcomes


Requirements

What You Will Do


You will be a critical team member in a unique partnership to industrialize Scientific AI. As such, you will engage directly with customers onsite a couple of days per week in the Copenhagen Region, building strong relationships, deeply understanding their scientific data challenges and requirements, and accelerating solutions
Design and implement extensible, reusable data models that efficiently capture and organize scientific data for scientific use cases, ensuring scalability and future adaptability
Translate scientific data workflows into robust solutions leveraging the Tetra Data Platform
Own, scope, prototype, and implement solutions including:
Data model design (tabular & JSON)
Python-based parser development
Lab software (e.g., ELN/LIMS) integration via APIs
Data visualization and app development in Python (using app frameworks like Streamlit and plotting tools like holoviews and Plotly)
Collaborate with Scientific Business Analysts (SBAs), customer scientists and applied AI engineers to develop and deploy models (ML, AI, mechanistic, statistical, hybrid)
Programmatically interrogating proprietary instrument output files
Dynamically iterate with scientific end users and technical stakeholders to rapidly drive solution development and adoption through regular demos and meetings
Proactively communicate implementation progress and deliver demos to customer stakeholders
Collaborate with the product team to build and prioritize our roadmap by understanding customers' pain points within and outside Tetra Data Platform
Rapidly learn new technologies (e.g., new AWS services or scientific analysis applications) to develop and troubleshoot use cases


Benefits


Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company
Supportive, team-oriented culture of continuous improvement
Generous paid time off (PTO)
Flexible working arrangements - Remote work when not at Customer Sites


We are not currently providing visa sponsorship for this position.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company
  • Supportive, team-oriented culture of continuous improvement
  • Generous paid time off (PTO)
  • Flexible working arrangements - Remote work when not at Customer Sites

We are not currently providing visa sponsorship for this position.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




Metaceutic is seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist with expertise in machine learning, AI, and big data analysis within metagenomics and microbiome-based data science. This role will be critical in strengthening our core technology engine, applying cutting-edge AI-driven data mining techniques to microbiome datasets, and contributing to the development of personalised healthcare solutions.




Key Responsibilities




Develop and optimise AI and machine learning algorithms for microbiome data interpretation.
Implement big data analytics pipelines to process large-scale metagenomics datasets efficiently.
Design and refine predictive models for microbiome-health associations.
Work closely with bioinformaticians, systems biologists, and software engineers to integrate AI-driven insights into Metaceutic’s data analysis platform.
Apply deep learning, statistical modeling, and pattern recognition to identify novel microbiome-based biomarkers and interventions.
Contribute to scientific publications, patents, and conferences in microbiome research.
Collaborate with the business team to translate scientific insights into commercial applications for healthcare and biotech partners.

‍

‍

Needed Qualifications




PhD or MSc in Data Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong coding experience in Python, R, or similar with experience in machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Experience working with metagenomic sequencing data (16S, shotgun metagenomics) and bioinformatics tools.
Proven experience in big data analysis and cloud computing (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Expertise in statistical modeling, deep learning, and AI for biological data.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in an interdisciplinary environment.
Prior experience in healthcare, microbiome science, or systems biology is a plus.

‍

‍

What We Offer




Opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI-driven microbiome research.
Competitive salary and equity options.
Collaborative and fast-paced startup environment with a strong scientific foundation.
Direct impact on shaping the future of personalised healthcare and microbiome technology.




Show more
